revised_title: Fossil Reptilia: Structure, Organisation, and Classification of Anomodont Reptile Bones
tldr: This article examines the structure, organization, and classification of fossil reptiles, specifically the bones of a small Anomodont Reptile (Keirognathus cordylus). The author, H.G. Seeley, investigates the shoulder girdle and fore-limb bones, comparing them to other reptiles and monotreme mammals. The findings contribute to understanding the evolution and relationships between different reptile groups and early mammals.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Vertebrate Paleobiology
